column4: as soon as i install and configure xserver-xorg on a server here and i start it my screen goes blank. accessing other vty's doesn't work either. even rebooting (regardless the runlevel) results in a blank screen when xserver is installed
any ideas what may be wrong?
Can you get to one of the other terminals (CTRLALT+F2)?
no, they're all blank
Can you start in recovery mode (single user) and check out the /var/log/Xorg.log ?
i can
should i paste the contents somewhere? (+suggestions where)
http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/8913/ contains a dump of the log
Checking now...
What did you follow to get your radeon installed?
i installed the xserver-xorg package (+xfonts packages and xdm), then i performed a dpkg-reconfigure xserver-xorg
it automatically discovered and identified the ati card
Any chance you wanna install the accelerated ati drivers?
you mean i should install the provided fglrx package?
Sorry I only buy nvidia.
i'm quite confident with that, but why is that xserver on all the vty's, and why does it even start when booting runlevel 2?
runlevel 2 is the default. Apparently that's how it's done around here. Weird I know. Which distro are you from?
i'm using ubuntu server 6.06 on that machine, i use to work with suse or ubuntu. i thought runlevel 5 is the only runlevel that allows x server
Depends where one puts one init scripts...
np.
i got further now, this time xserver attempts to start but fails, saying "no screens found"
